title: U.K.’s Top Court Hears Case Against Boris Johnson Suspending Parliament
text:
LONDON—The U.K.’s highest court waded into Britain’s Brexit drama as it began deliberations on whether Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s decision to suspend Parliament this month was lawful.

Mr. Johnson’s bitterly contested move deepened the battle over the U.K.’s split with the European Union. The 11-member panel of Supreme Court justices must decide whether Mr. Johnson acted within the law when he advised Queen Elizabeth II to suspend—or prorogue—Parliament for five weeks beginning Sept. 9.

...
description: The U.K.’s highest court waded into Britain’s Brexit drama as it began deliberations on whether Prime Minister Boris Johnson’s decision to suspend Parliament for weeks this month was lawful.
